name: Baozi
description: Steamed buns filled with a variety of savory or sweet fillings.
ingredients: filling of choice (e.g., pork, vegetables, red bean paste)
instructions: Mix the flour, yeast, and water to form a dough.
Allow dough to rise for about 2 hours.
Divide dough into small portions.
Fill each portion with your choice of filling.
Place buns in a steamer and steam for about 15 minutes.

name: Pretzel Bun
description: Soft, chewy buns with a distinctive pretzel flavor and a shiny, dark outer crust.
instructions: Combine ingredients to form a dough.
Let dough rise for 1 hour.
Divide into small portions and shape into buns.
Boil buns briefly in a baking soda water bath.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 15-20 minutes or until golden brown.

name: Baguette
description: Long, thin buns with a crisp crust and soft, chewy interior.
instructions: Combine the flour, yeast, water, and salt to form a dough.
Allow dough to rise for about 2 hours.
Divide dough into portions and shape each into a long, thin loaf.
Preheat oven to 475°F (245°C).
Bake for about 20-25 minutes or until golden brown.

name: Challah
description: Rich, sweet buns made with eggs and often braided before baking.
instructions: Combine the ingredients to form a dough.
Allow dough to rise for about 2 hours.
Divide dough into portions and braid to form buns.
Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Bake for about 20-25 minutes or until golden brown.
